favourite.article: Allowed myself to fall into a pit of self-absorbed loathing. Difficult week, wasted precious time and opportunity. Yesterday; "Lord Jesus, what is wrong with me? Why do I not keep my eye on You, Your heart's yearnings. How can I forget the only safe place is through / in You --- and You went to the cross." Light began to sneak into my gray soul. A sister texted me a quote from this hymn today. Scanned some of the comments here. The scriptures referenced so stabilizing. Someone said, "Make this your anthem today."

My Quiet Time reading from Word for Today was from 2 Chronicles 20 and verse 12. This old hymn was layed on my heart, the words of the chorus kept coming to mind. Turn your eyes upon Jesus. Praise God in the way He works in our lives, Amen.
I was praying when a portion of this old hymn came to my mind...how truly the things of this world grow dim when we bask in His light.. Praise God!
I woke up with this scripture (Matthew 17:8) in my head, linking to this song, then I recalled this song. Thank You Lord for the great gift of salvation.
I woke up with this song in my head. Love this beautiful hymn.

I was sleeping and awoke to the tune of this song which I had not heard for some time. Then I tried to recall the words to the tune. I only could recall the chorus part, and then came here to search. Just what I needed. Thank You Lord Jesus for Your Great Love!
In a world that is sometimes so dark His light shines so beautifully. Thank You, Jesus, for Your salvation and for never leaving us.

Praise be to God, Jesus and the Holy Spirit. God through His Son will gather you up and hold you so no harm becomes of you. This song is a song of the heart and soul, a saving and wonderful Blessing. In times of trouble and deceit, we who are His children must trust on the firm foundation of our Savior, Jesus. Your treasures are NOT of this world. True peace and happiness are only found through trust in the Lord and waiting for the Lord to work his will through us. This song, as short as it is, will lift you up and carry you to a higher place, away from this world and to the saving light of the Father. Amen.

I'm blown away and blessed so much, again, by You Lord, all these many hearts worshiping You and trusting You, I love You so much. You will allow us to see You and You will allow that we can see each other soon, You being our God and we your children for ever and ever, we worship You, we love You, because You love us so much. Eph. 2:10
Show me Your way, Lord.

Amen to all those who have said the truth and nothing but the truth about Jesus our Lord and Saviour. We ought always to turn our eyes upon Jesus because He is our only hope in whatever situation we face in life. What a blessed thing it is to be SAVED and know for sure that we have a place in Heaven for all Eternity. More than half of the world has rejected the Saviour who died for their sins on that cruel Cross at Calvary. Praise be to God and all honour and Glory are His for all eternity. Amen.

TURN YOUR EYES UPON JESUS BIBLE MEDITATION: “And Jesus answering saith unto them, Have faith in God.” Mk 11:22
DEVOTIONAL THOUGHT: I ask some Christians, “How are you doing?” They say, “Okay—under the circumstances.” How did you ever get there?
Circumstances are like a mattress. You’re supposed to be on it, not under it. Under the circumstances, you suffocate; on them you rest pretty well.
The only way you can run the race is to take your eyes off things or people around you and look to Jesus. He’s the author of the race. He’s the goal to which you run. If you look to Jesus to supply your every need for the race, you’ll find faith growing in your heart and in your life. You see, it’s not great faith in God; it is faith in a great God.
ACTION POINT: Do you have a hymnal in your home? Find the hymn “Turn Your Eyes Upon Jesus” by Helen Lemmel and make it your anthem today!
I needed help and I found it here. Praise God, thank you.

What a blessing to have this music made available and to be reminded through this song . . . that it is in Him that we have our encouragement, hope and love! THANKS BE TO GOD . . . and may we give GOD the Glory always!
We need a reminder often as to what is truly Eternal and what is Truly Important....

All these Jesus loving, spirit filled hearts worshipping together in a comment section of all places. God brought so many of His children here to worship Him and leave little pieces of their hearts and journey with God for others to see, glorifying and magnifying the Lord with joy! Just scrolling through this has reminded me of God's loving nature and how He places such joy in people's hearts through worshipping Him. God is so good!!! Constantly He reminds me all I need to do is look back at Him and everything is ok, so I'm thanking God for His work in all of those who sing these words and for Him speaking through them. Glory be God's!
...And the things of earth will grow strangely dim in the light of His glory and grace...
Love and truth expressed in word, carried by sweet melody, wrapping your soul in Jesus arms. Oh that men would know Him.
Turn your eyes upon Jesus! Jesus!

Thank You Lord, for inspiring Helen Howarth with this beautiful and touching song that can get so deep into our souls reminding us to keep focused on You during our daily life. Thank you to Hymnal.net who provided for us the music and lyrics of this inspiring song.
This song is absolutely beautiful: lyrics and music both! It is so inspiring and meaningful. I could listen to it all day long. Thank you so much!!!
We are so Lucky, Believe Him and all will be well. Turn your eyes upon Jesus!!
It is where we look and live. Looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of our faith.

This song that my late Grand Mother usually used to sing ....she teach me this song and I like to sing it until now.. I feel down today...just when I heard it the tear in my eyes falls away..Lord Jesus I need You and I want to focus to You. You touch me again and again. Glory!!
Sweet Jesus, please help me to keep my eyes on You, as I go to work each day.
This is such deep wisdom. Thank You Jesus, all praise to You. :)
Oh Lord Jesus! It's by looking unto You!

We can so easily get distracted by worldly wows, when it seems so hard to focus our eyes on the One who knows. Fix your eyes upon Jesus, look full into His wonderful face and the things of earth will grow strangely dim in the light of His glory and grace.
This is a favorite hymn - telling me to stay fully focused on HIM!
I love it. It tells me how great GOD is.
Love it!
Such beautiful words... a hymn with so much meaning... so different than the ever so repetitious words to a melody of the songs of today!

I use to sing this hymn years ago with the salvation army, the chorus had been going through my head for days, I had forgotten the verses. Thanks to everyone who puts these songs out there for us and the lost to find. I pray for a special blessing to all today. God is so Great, God Bless.
I only knew of the beautiful chorus, till today, then I found the rest of this great hymn. Jesus is better than we can imagine.
One of the best, wonderful beautiful face of my Lord Jesus Christ shall I always look upon. I love You so much my Lord. Thank you!

Beautiful song. On one level turning our eyes on Jesus helps us overcome hardship, but He's just so beautiful and so incomprehendingly good that the more aware of Him and His true nature we are, even really good things on this earth are just less interesting by comparison. I wish I was in this zone so much more.
We sang this yesterday at church and it changed my attitude towards life and all its challenges. I love the chorus so much it spoke straight to my heart.
Turn your eyes upon Jesus and look full in His wonderful face!!!

"Paul not only counted all things loss for the sake of Christ, but counted all things as dung. According to his accounting, everything meant nothing. Because he always counted everything loss for the sake of Christ, he constantly enjoyed Christ. The more things you deny, the more Christ will replace you and the more He becomes your experience and enjoyment. Our slogan should be this: "Oh, that I may gain Christ!""
—The Experience of Christ, ch. 8
For vision and courage and comfort every day I need it.

Yes, my prolonged difficulty, unrelieved pain, makes me to turn my eyes upon Jesus. His life was not of ease and fame. It was of the cross. His life makes me to hope in God who raised Him from death. Yes, He is risen. He is living in me and with me forever as my Lord and Savior. He overcame. He prevailed. I love You, Jesus, my God, my Lord!
Yes it is scripturally TRUE. As I go through what I am going through, only my focus on His Holy Face will dismiss and still the storm and Birth a Miracle that I so crucially need. Thank You JESUS
O how we need to turn our eyes to our dear Lord Jesus and behold Him constantly! He will be so near and so dear to us!
When we turn our eyes to Jesus, we enjoy all the riches of Him in our spirit. If we turn we are actually conquerers.

What a great work you are doing with this hymnal. Thank you so much for your faithful service to the Lord. I benefit from this every day, and I am sure so many other brothers and sisters in Christ do also! I have sometimes brought my computer to a prayer meeting so we can sing a new song together.

Thank You Lord, we have the unhindered access to Your face in our spirit. "The Lord Jesus be with your spirit." 2 Timothy 4:22. The eyes of our heart (soul) may always look upon Your shining face in our spirit. Lord Jesus, I love You, may I turn to my spirit (where Your presence is) always. I wanna see You in whatever vision or spiritual scene You reveal to me. Acts. 26:16b.
Inspirational healing.

This song came to my mind after reading the news and hearing all of the negative talk after the election. I was reading my devotion and it just popped into my mind. It is very soothing to thing of looking into Jesus' face.
Tonight is (post) election night and it did not turn out the way I had hoped. this song came to mind as a reminder. I love the hymns...so solid!

This song holds so many memories of Sunday night service where this was a favorite chorus. The words are so true and encourage me to let go of worldly concerns and look only at His wonderful face. In Him I find peace.
Like Angie Lim in Manila NCR Philipines, I only learned the chorus. I don't find the verses so easy to learn. What a beautiful, comforting chorus!
Brings tears to my eyes just thinking of how much my eyes need to be focused on Jesus and not on the things of this world....If only we could see through Jesus' eyes!!!
The words are just sooo powerful. Love You Lord!

Sang this in Sunday School and Youth Group. I did not understand it then but when life's great challenges confront me, it came back suddenly. We must keep our eyes on Jesus to live this life. Otherwise, we will be like Peter, distracted by the angry waves while walking on water towards Jesus. Keep your eyes upon Jesus. Faith will follow!

How soothing is the music and how reassuring are the words of this hymn. Indeed as we gaze on Jesus we look away from our predicament and draw strength from Him, so that we can hear Him say as He said to Paul: "My grace is sufficient for you..." 2 Cor. 12:9. Thank God for His faithfulness and lovingkindness and for the author and composer of this hymn.

Praise God in times of uncertainties one thing is certain that God is there. "Be still and know that I am God..." Praise His holy name, "I AM". God, Jesus and the Holy Spirit, the blessed One, eternal, changeless God, always, "...a very help in times of trouble."
"Lord my eyes are set upon YOU"
A year and a half after I last commented, I can still enjoy this song, yet in a different way. Lord, we love You. Isn't it sweet that we can gaze on His face? And He takes care of our soul?
Many earthly thing just make my soul weary and troubled, my eyes dark and I'm sunk...this a strong calling: TURN you eyes upon Jesus...praise the Lord!

This song is one of my old time favorites. However, it is only the chorus that I have learned. I didnt know that there were verses in this song. So I just learned it now from your site. Thank you for posting it. By the way I want to share this one chorus that my friend shared with me. I really dont know who wrote it...same tune with the chorus: "Fix your thoughts upon Jesus And others will not take His place And in every trial, He will give you power 'til at last you have won the last race."

O Lord Jesus! I confess today my soul is weary and troubled. Cause me to turn my eyes upon You, not anyone else, not anything else. Upon You Lord, to look FULL into Your wonderful face. May the things of earth grow dim, in the light of Your glory and grace. I declare that I still love You Lord Jesus!

I have enjoyed this hymn for many years. If I may, here is some background on this hymn: The author and composer of this hymn, Helen H Lemmel, relates that one day, in 1918, a missionary friend gave her a tract entitled "Focused." The pamphlet contained these words - - - "So then, turn your eyes upon Him, look full into His face and you will find that the things of earth will acquire a strange new dimness." These words made a deep impression upon her. She could not dismiss them from her mind. She recalls this experience following the reading of that tract: "Suddenly, as if commanded to stop and listen, I stood still, and singing in my soul and spirit was the Chorus, with not one conscious moment of putting word to word to make rhyme, or note to note to make melody. The verses were written the same week, after the usual manner of composition, but none the less dictated by the Holy Spirit." -Adapted from Kenneth Osbeck

I really enjoyed this hymn. As a young person, I am getting to know the Lord in a more personal and intimate way. And as I see the Lord more as my Friend and Companion, I realize that all the worries and troubles I have, everything I go through, the Lord is there with me. I just have to turn to Him and enjoy Him! And my burdens will be carried for me! That I can gain more of Him!

Since late last year, I became worried over some health issues. I am taking medication but I feel that I am not getting healed and my health will never be the same again. I knew this was the Lord's chastisement. The Lord wanted me to come back to Him. Upon the Lord's mercy, I heeded His call and He led me out of darkness and into His light again. Yesterday my sister told me that she has been enjoying this hymn in the last 2 weeks. I looked it up in the hymnal and it is hymn #645. Thank the Lord for giving me this hymn. It serves as a great reminder that I must constantly turn my eyes upon Jesus and let Jesus take over all my health problems. Hallelujah! I received much help too from the comments posted by beloved saints all over the world. Praise the Lord for His universal Body.

The Lord truly is everything to me, He lifts me up, and out of my troubles, when there is no help around me. I made a decision to trust Him, no matter what happens in my life. It is the best decision I ever made.

For so many years I have been overwhelmed with taking care of serious health problems in our family. I get so tired & discouraged. I often forget to "turn my eyes upon Jesus." When I remember, He gives me peace. It is wonderful to read other comments of how Christ is helping others. Reading them helps me feel not so alone.

PTL. I've been quite troubled recently about what to do with the entanglements of this world. It's answered so easily! "Turn your eyes upon Jesus! and the things of earth will grow strangely dim in the light of His glory and grace." Even when our will is weak, our strength is frail, and feel like there's no hope in being delivered from the body of this death, simply turn our eyes upon Jesus! Whenever our heart turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away!

O Lord Jesus, I love You. Thank You for always reminding me to turn my eyes upon You. I'm learning that everything is not real but Christ! You are the only thing that is real to me, Lord. I love You so much.
I usually sing this when I am weary and troubled. I t reminds me to turn to Him. I also enjoy the words "look full"...not partial but full!

I thank God for this site, it has been such a blessing to me, an encouragement to keep holding on.
Turn Your Eyes Upon Jesus
1. O soul are you and weary troubled? No light in the darkness you see? There's light for a look at the Savior, And life more abundant and free!
Turn your eyes upon Jesus, Look full in His wonderful face; And the things of this earth will grow strangely dim In the light of His glory and grace.
2. Through death into life everlasting He past and we follow Him there; Over us sin no more hath dominion, For more than conquerors we are!
3. His word shall not fail you He promised; Believe him and all will be well: Then go to the world that is dying, His perfect salvation to tell!

The light of His glory is available for us to enjoy in the face of Jesus Christ (2 Cor. 4:6). Praise the Lord we can just look full in His wonderful face to receive His marvelous shining. May we all reflect His shining as we behold Him daily with an unveiled face (2 Cor. 3:18).

It helps me very much in my morning time with the Lord. I usually distracted with so many thoughts that claim my attention. And this hymn really causes me to turn away from them and to be focused on the Lord's radiant face.

I really enjoyed this hymn at a recent YP meeting. It touched me so much that by looking away unto Jesus, turning our eyes upon Him, we can see His lovely face and just unveil our heart at that moment. When we turn to the Lord, immediately all the things of the earth will fade away. There are so many distractions in the world today that take away from our relationship with the Lord. I'm so glad that just by turning to Him we can be in His presence once more. =)
A very beautiful song. I enjoyed this thoroughly during a blending conference in Atlanta, GA. It was concerning experiencing Christ as our Shepherd. Praise the Lord.

My husband was wrongfully put in jail by my vindictive daughter-in-law.
This song was the one thing that kept me going and it would calm me.
Especially when I would get scared he would go to prison for a very long time.
When I sang it to myself, God would calm my fears.
Everything came out A OKAY with God's help.

At first glance, I would probably consider this hymn to be a bit shallow or short of truth, but lately the Lord has blessed me with some experience of the chorus.
"Turn your eyes upon Jesus, Look full in His wonderful face, And the things of earth will grow strangely dim, In the light of His glory and grace."
So often, my only focus is on my own situation, my own fears and concerns. I am totally selfish. I even refuse to turn to the Lord. However, this evening, the Lord was bothering me with the words of this chorus. I just need to turn my eyes on Him! What's important is not what is good for me, or what I want. The Lord has a desire. He wants to gain us fully, and this is done practically by our turning to Him. I want Him to be satisfied. Oh, may He keep us focused on Him hour by hour!
